value:
A headpiece from Annand featuring
the horn of a falicorn. The fine horn
radiates an aura of divinity.

key: MDAID_ファルコンの角飾り・極
MDAID_H_ファルコンの角飾り・極
value:
A headpiece from Annand featuring
the horn of a falicorn. Adorned with
bright white feathered wings.

A fluffy hat from Erinys. Of a style
common in Silesse. Very warm, even
in the most severe climates.

A fluffy hat from Erinys. Of a style
common in Silesse. Has a stylish
tail ornament on the back.

A hair ornament from Azelle. The inlay
features delicate workmanship and a
beautiful flame of special significance.

A hair ornament from Azelle. The inlay
features delicate workmanship and a
lavish red stone of hidden power.

A head protector from Lex. Despite its
quality, he claims to have found it on
the shore. Suited for forehead safety.

A head protector from Lex. Its quality
along with the axe-blade adornments
combine for an impressive look.

Leader of the Four Heavenly Knights of Silesse
and Erinys's elder sister. Conceals her longing
for Lewyn and fights to her last breath. Appears
in Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War.

One of the Four Heavenly Knights of Silesse and
Annand's younger sister. Has a serious outlook
that Prince Lewyn teases her about. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War.

Half brother to the head of House Velthomer,
Arvis. Compares himself to his older brother and
suffers from an inferiority complex. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War.

Second son of Duke Lombard of House Dozel.
Joins the army under Sigurd's command along
with his friend Azelle. Appears in Fire Emblem:
Genealogy of the Holy War.

One of the Four Heavenly Knights of Silesse.
Comes to serve Lord Myos, youngest brother
of the late king. Appears in Fire Emblem:
Genealogy of the Holy War.

The younger of the princesses of Jötunheimr,
and Nótt's twin sister. Cheerful and big-hearted,
but also ready for a scrap when the time comes.

If her partner is near, she can attack
up to four times! Has a skill to raise
stats and score higher in the Arena.

Her Atk/Def go up when attacking,
and foes can't follow-up. When she's
attacked, blocks half the first attack!

Easy follow-ups and strong against
high-Res foes. Can treat all stats as
higher to score higher in the Arena.

Can attack twice with his axe whether
initiating attack or being attacked, and
protects allies with his strong defense.

Grants Def+5 and inflicts Spd/Res-5 on unit.
Unit attacks twice. (Even if foe initiates combat,
unit attacks twice.)

If unit is not adjacent to an ally, inflicts
Atk/Def-5 on foe during combat and
neutralizes foe's bonuses to Atk/Def (from
skills like Fortify, Rally, etc.) during combat.

If unit is not adjacent to an ally, inflicts
Atk/Def-5 on foe during combat and
neutralizes foe's bonuses to Atk/Def (from
skills like Fortify, Rally, etc.) during combat.

Grants Atk+3. At start of combat, if foe's HP
≥ 50%, grants Atk/Spd+6 to unit during combat,
and also, if unit is within 2 spaces of support
partner and initiates combat, unit attacks twice.

$aGrants Spd+3 and【Pathfinder】.
At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 25%,
grants Atk/Spd/Def/Res+5 and bonus to
Atk/Spd/Def/Res during combat = current
penalty on each of those stats × 2. (Example:
if unit has -7 penalty to Atk, grants Atk+19,
for a net bonus of Atk+12.) Calculates each
stat bonus independently.

【Pathfinder】
When an ally moves through unit's space, that
space is counted as 0 spaces moved instead of
1 space. (Unit's space can be freely added to
ally's normal movement. Applies only to allies
with movement types that allow movement
through unit's space.)

Grants Spd+3. At start of combat, if foe's HP
≥ 50%, inflicts Spd/Res-6 on foe during combat
and inflicts penalty on foe's Spd/Res during
combat = current bonus on each of foe's
stats × 2. (Example: if foe has +7 bonus to Spd,
inflicts Spd-20, for a net penalty of Spd-13.)
Calculates each stat penalty independently.

Grants HP+5, Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2. If unit is 5★,
level 40, a Legendary Hero or a Mythic Hero,
and unit's stats total less than 175, treats unit's
stats as 175 in modes like Arena. If unit is 5★,
level 40, not a Legendary Hero or Mythic Hero
and unit's stats total less than 180, treats unit's
stats as 180 in modes like Arena.
(Higher-scoring opponents will appear. Stat
total calculation excludes any values added by
merges and skills.)

Grants HP+5, Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2. If unit is 5★,
level 40, a Legendary Hero or a Mythic Hero,
and unit's stats total less than 175, treats unit's
stats as 175 in modes like Arena. If unit is 5★,
level 40, not a Legendary Hero or Mythic Hero
and unit's stats total less than 180, treats unit's
stats as 180 in modes like Arena.
(Higher-scoring opponents will appear. Stat
total calculation excludes any values added by
merges and skills.)

The continent of Elibe had long been
at peace, keeping a delicate balance
between its nations. But the sudden
death of the king of Bern, one of its
major powers, ended that peace. The
new king, Zephiel, sought supremacy.
He worked together with dragons,
who had lost the battle for dominion
over Elibe long before. Together, they
began their invasions, dragging the
entire continent into war...

Bern's Wyvern General Narcian and
his wyvern knights invaded Lycia,
scattering its forces, leaving Roy in
need of aid. Etruria answered. With
the help of his teacher Cecilia, Mage
General of Etruria, Roy was able to
heroically beat back Bern's assault...

The Lycian forces, under Etruria's
protection, were dispatched to the
Western Isles with orders to subdue
a gang of bandits. Upon arrival, Roy
learned the local Etrurian nobles
were turning a blind eye to the
bandits in order to extort their own
people. As he pressed on, Roy met
a group of resistance fighters—and
along with them, a bard calling
himself Elffin...

As the League quelled corruption in
the Western Isles, an Etrurian faction
in collusion with Bern revolted and
captured the Etrurian king, who had
fallen ill with grief over news of the
death of his son, the prince. Roy,
knowing that Cecilia would be fighting
the uprising, left the Western Isles in
order to aid her—for not even she
could stand alone before Bern's king
and the Wyvern Generals...

After saving Cecilia, Roy and the
League's forces marched on the
Etrurian capital to end the uprising.
Perched in the throne room, Narcian
awaited their arrival, rallying his
troops to face the League head-on...

The long struggle for the capital came
to an end with Roy prevailing and
putting a halt to the uprising. In the
end, Elffin, the mysterious bard who
had given the League his support,
was revealed to be Myrddin, the
prince of Etruria who the king and
people had thought perished...
